jot.io.device

Interface Input

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    TrackableInput
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    KeyBoard, Mouse

    public interface Input
    Interface that specifies the core methods to implement for a generic input handler.
    Author:
    G. Amador & A. Gomes

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isContinuouslyDetecting(java.lang.String inputEvent)
      Test if for a generic input device and specific provided event is occurring, e.g., mouse button or keyboard key is pressed.
      boolean isDetecting(java.lang.String inputEvent)
      Test if for a generic input device and specific provided event is occurring, e.g., mouse button or keyboard key is typed/clicked.
      void registerInputEvent(java.lang.String inputEvent, int inputDeviceEvent)
      Register a specific inputEvent to be associated with a generic input device event, e.g., associate "shoot" with a key pressed.

    • Method Detail

      • registerInputEvent

        void registerInputEvent(java.lang.String inputEvent,
                        int inputDeviceEvent)
        Register a specific inputEvent to be associated with a generic input device event, e.g., associate "shoot" with a key pressed.
        Parameters:
        inputEvent - to be associated with a generic input device event.
        inputDeviceEvent - generic input device event.

      • isDetecting

        boolean isDetecting(java.lang.String inputEvent)
        Test if for a generic input device and specific provided event is occurring, e.g., mouse button or keyboard key is typed/clicked.
        Parameters:
        inputEvent - specific provided generic input event, e.g., mouse button clicked, keyboard key typed, 3D camera detected movement, etc.
        Returns:
        TRUE if provided input event is occurring, otherwise returns FALSE.

      • isContinuouslyDetecting

        boolean isContinuouslyDetecting(java.lang.String inputEvent)
        Test if for a generic input device and specific provided event is occurring, e.g., mouse button or keyboard key is pressed.
        Parameters:
        inputEvent - specific provided generic input event, e.g., mouse button pressed, keyboard key press, 3D camera detected movement, etc.
        Returns:
        TRUE if provided input event is occurring, otherwise returns FALSE.
